result.execSummary:
The defendant Kabrina L. Roth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order for payment of Atty. Karl Huebner as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $392.

It is hereby ordered that: The Defendant is liable for court appointed attorney fees.  The remaining balance of attorney fees shall be paid as a condition of probation.  The Judgment of Conviction shall be amended to reflect said order.  Probation and Parole shall be notified.
with attachments and proposed order for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Attorney Karl Huebner in the amount of $392 .
with attached Criminal Case Settlement and Elements

Case called at am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Kabrina L. Roth in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1 & #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3

On Counts #1 & #4, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--No acts/threats of violence
--To comply with any further treatment needs recommended by Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--No possession of weapons or ammunition
--Mental health treatment per Agent
--To pay statutory costs
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge (on Count #1)
--To submit DNA Sample if not already on file

Days credit for time already served: 2 days
Recess: 11:26 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 3, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 3:16pm. 
Defendant Kabrina L. Roth in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Huebner indicates that the case should be set for a plea and sentencing hearing. 
The Court instructs Ms. Roth to stay in touch with her attorney and return to court on June 3rd. 
recess 3:17pm. 

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing hearing on 6/3/16 at 11:00am

Case called at 3:03 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Kabrina L. Roth in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Huebner: Received additional information today from Miss Roth, request matter be set for additional PTC & STC
DA Happ: No objection
Court reminds Miss Roth that her bond remains in effect
Recess: 3:05 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule DA PTC 2/24/16 at 1:00 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule 3/18/16 at 3:00 pm - Send notices

Case called at 10:50 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Kabrina L. Roth in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court vacates warrant as Defendant now appears. 
Atty Huebner: Was offer made before my appearance on matter - request new PTC and STC on matter
ADA Shock: No objection
Court informs parties that Miss Roth must appear at STC
Court informs Miss Roth that her bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 10:53 am Reconvene: 10:53 am
Miss Roth addresses atty fee payment concerns with the Court
She agrees to continue payments at $25/month
Recess: 10:54 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule DA PTC - 1/6/16 at 1:00 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule STC 1/29/16 at 3:00 pm - Send notices

Case called at 3:40pm [mo]
Defendant Kabrina L. Roth appears via telephone.
Attorney Karl Huebner appears in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reschedules the hearing for 12/29/15 at 10:45am.
The Court issues a bench warrant, shall Ms. Roth not appear tomorrow the bench warrant will be issued. 
recess: 3:43pm

NEXT: Status Conference on 12/29/15 at 10:45am

Court orders reimbursement of Atty fees at the rate of $25 per month beginning 1/2/16 and on the 1st day of the month thereafter until further order of the Court. Failure to pay will be addressed at later date.

Case called at 4:13 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Kabrina L. Roth in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews case file documents, indicating that Miss Roth had PTC but it was canceled, then another date was set.
Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Hall indicates that there have been discussion with Miss Roth and ADA Teuber - appears Miss Roth would like trial
Miss Roth informs the Court that she went back to SPD and she does not qualify, indicates that she has paperwork for court appointed counsel
Clerk retrieves and indicates that paperwork is not completed - Court indicates that It will complete orally with Miss Roth

Kabrina Roth--sworn & testifies
--exam by the Court

Court finds Miss Roth indigent and appoints Attorney Karl Huebner. Court orders reimbursement of Atty fees at the rate of $25 per month beginning 1/2/16 and on the 1st day of the month thereafter until further order of the Court. Failure to pay will be addressed at later date.
Recess: 4:26 pm 

NEXT: Schedule STC 12/28/15 at 3:30 pm -Send notices

ADDRESS INFO for Kabrina L. Roth
Current: PO Box 633, Pewaukee, WI 53072 United States  (Effective: 12-04-2015)
Prior: 601 Adams Street, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538 United States

Case called at 9:34am [mo]
Defendant Kabrina L. Roth in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Ms. Roth indicates that she does not qualify for PD representation.
Ms. Roth further indicates that she had a PTC scheduled with the DA's office and it was cancelled.
The Court gives Ms. Roth her right to counsel.

Ms. Roth indicates she would like an opportunity to speak with the prosecutor to negotiate a resolution.
The Court schedules this case for another PTC and STC, Ms. Roth has indicated that she works late, therefore the Court scheduled later hearings. 

recess: 9:42am

NEXT: (1)Pretrial Conference on 11/11/15 at 4:00pm (2)Status Conference on 12/4/15 at 4:00pm

ADDRESS INFO for Kabrina L. Roth
Current: 601 Adams Street, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538 United States  (Effective: 09-21-2015)
Prior: 207 Sheperd St., Johnson Creek, WI 53038

[MK] case called at 1:29pm. 
Defendant Kabrina L. Roth appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (PD counsel appears for Bond purposes only).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Right to counsel given.
Ms. Roth verifies that the date of birth on the Criminal Complaint is correct.  She provides a new address of 601 Adams Street, Fort Atkinson.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.

The Court requires a $2,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Kasper Roth, I.J.R. or H.R.
--no presence at the residence of Kasper Roth
--no possession of any dangerous weapons as defined by Statute  [Statute 939.22(10)]
recess 1:33pm. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/7/15 at 8:20am (2) Status Conference on 10/30/15 at 9:30am
